Check your “friends” list from time to time. If you have more of those who are only there when you’re smiling, it’s time to rethink the list! Keep those who are there for you when you face storms in life close to your heart. They’re the ones whose friendship you need to nurture

Quit worrying about your past. Things happen for a reason. The Almighty never wastes a moment of what you have experienced. What you went through in the past can be the catalyst for change that’s needed for tomorrow. Remember, if He is for you, nobody can be against you!

Gratitude is key to success in this world & the Hereafter. A grateful heart is everything. Remember, the Almighty’s unaffected if you become ungrateful. We thank Him for our own benefit. It’s only through sincere thankfulness that we can achieve whatever He has laid out for us!

Don’t burn bridges just because you think you’ve arrived at a desired level in life & don’t look down on those doing poorly in life. The truth is life has a way of giving back to you what you dish out to others. What goes around comes around. So be wary when  dealing with others!

Be kind to everyone. Never think you're above others.The trouble with those who appear pious is that they think they’re on a higher level and scoff at everyone else who may seem less pious! It’s a terrible trait to have. Don’t be hard on people. Piety comes with gentleness.

Almighty. We’re living in heartbreaking times as the global health crisis from the virus escalates. Grant ease to families who have lost loved ones, healthcare personnel risking their own lives. We know You are our ever-present help in distressing times. Let us keep hope alive!

Every part of the world is infected by the virus and indeed the aura of terror has spread far and wide. But amid all the doom and gloom, there’s indeed a sliver lining. Nature is slowly recovering from pollution, families are spending more time together. We will get through this!

Don’t waste time worrying. It robs you of your peace, clouds  your judgement & keeps you busy doing nothing. Seek comfort from the Almighty.  Pour your heart out to Him. Let Him take over. You’ll feel a sense of relief knowing He will open doors you thought were closed forever.

Don’t overthink. Don’t overreact. Now, more than ever, we need to learn how to handle our emotions and stop ourselves from stressing out. There’s so much going on around us that it’s easy to fly off the handle. Don’t. Control yourself. Seek your strength form the Almighty!

Prayer is not about you getting what you want from the Almighty as & when you want it. It’s more than that. The act of connecting with Him, building your relationship with Him, how you ask Him - all these are key! Keep the communication going daily, not just when you’re in need!

During these stressful days, be selective when engaging others. Ask yourself, “Do I need to handle this right now?” If things don’t require immediate response, spend some time reflecting before answering. You’ll make wiser decisions when you’ve had  time to calm down & reflect.

Keep your sense of inner peace. Use only kind words and don’t provoke others. Tensions are high right now as the world finds itself in the midst of a global pandemic. Normal ways of life are being challenged and it’s understandable that more people are feeling a little on-edge.

Be careful when you’ve hurt someone deliberately. If you’re guilty, apologise as soon as possible. Don’t hesitate. You may not have time tomorrow. May the Almighty protect us from being the source of pain and tears in someone else's life! May He forgive our sins and shortcoming!

Why is it that at times, the immoral, unethical, impermissible way of doing things appeal to us? It’s because we’re human & Satan tempts us with worldly distractions. If we remain conscious of the Almighty, He will provide for us in ways that we never expected. Remain steadfast!

If you feel like nothing seems to be going right, don’t despair. The Almighty didn’t promise us a straight route to Paradise. Expect twists & turns. Bumpy rides. Disappointments. They will happen at some stage. It’s all according to His Plan. Bear patience & you’ll get there!

Misinformation is bad news. Actually, in our current climate, misinformation is lethal. It can kill. So please be aware of what you’re spreading. If you cannot verify it, it’s best not to spread it. It’s better to err on the side of caution than to cause panic and pandemonium!

Almighty. You’re our refuge and strength. We know that everything is in Your Sovereign control. We know that You will heal the world from this virus. Have mercy on us. May compassion and empathy be our touchstones when dealing with people during this difficult time. Aameen!

Be careful when you’ve hurt someone deliberately. If you’re guilty, apologise as soon as possible. Don’t hesitate. You may not have time tomorrow. May the Almighty protect us from being the source of pain and tears in someone else's life! May He forgive our sins and shortcoming!

When you feel like giving up, you’re actually missing out on what the Almighty has in store for you. It’s easy to feel overwhelmed in the current situation. But you must stay firm in faith. Know that you are not alone. He’s watching our moves and how we cope! Help is very near!

What have we learnt from this outbreak? That there are still many good people out there; we have not lost touch with humanity & we’re all trying to cope in the best way we can. But it has also shown up cracks in our society. Hoarding, panic buying etc. Let us mend our ways!

Just because you can’t see a way doesn’t mean there’s no way. The Almighty is working behind the scenes and we need only to trust Him, have faith, keep doing what we must and He will do the rest. Remember, what is impossible with man is possible with Him. Never lose faith!

With most of us housebound and with family or flatmates, nerves are bound to snap. Be mindful of your present situation and environment. Learn to stay calm and get on with your own activities. Let others do theirs. Resist the urge to get involved in other people’s affairs!

Usually on the 1st of April, we won't be able to tell fact from fable. But today, I strongly believe that we should be responsible. I urge you NOT to mislead people, cause panic, instil a sense of false hope or fear and later claim that we were fooling around!

Never lose hope in what the Almighty can do. You may be uncertain, confused, unsure & even fearful. But refuse to give fear the power it needs to consume us. Faith and fear don’t go hand in hand. We firmly believe in Him alone. He has our back not only today but everyday!

We may be surprised by the turn  of events in our lives but nothing that happens is a surprise to the Almighty. He knows everything to the minutest detail. He has planned it all. We need to embrace each day in the best possible way, knowing that He has our backs always!

Lay your trust in the Almighty and rely on Him by all means but you must play your part! Do your level best and let Him take over. It’s natural to feel anxious in this fast-paced world but it can be managed well if we confide in Him often. He is the Owner of all solutions!

Things can happen at the drop of a hat! We’ve seen that lately! There’s so much to be done & there’s too little time. Remember, tomorrow is not promised to anyone. Seize today. Prioritise your activities. Make an impact. Leave a mark. Life’s too short to be doing otherwise!

Panic-scrolling through the news on social media can be counterproductive. Social distancing has us stuck in our homes & most of us are trying to keep up with the avalanche of information coming out each day. Perhaps it’s time to quarantine social media for several hours daily?

We’re living in unprecedented times. What I’m writing now will likely be out of date tomorrow.  The scale of what’s happening is hard to grasp. Only the Almighty with His Divine Wisdom knows the answer. We have to get used to this new norm. Get closer to the One who’s in control!

Social distancing may be the new buzzword but that hasn’t dampened community spirit in this pandemic. We hear stories how humanity is so much alive, with people showing love & kindness all round.  Remember to be kind always because such acts spread faster than any virus!

Almighty. We pray for the many families & business owners facing financial stress. It can be scary & overwhelming not knowing how bills & obligations will be met or to not be able to provide for loved ones. Grant them comfort & ease knowing that You’re the Owner of Sustenance!

Our blessings may not be so obvious sometimes. It may come in an unpalatable way. Don’t be upset. Embrace the suffering with beautiful patience. Thank Him for everything that He has bestowed on us. Things will become clearer soon. Trust the process.

Almighty. As more become infected with the virus, healthcare workers & medical staff worldwide are working longer hours with higher risk of contracting the disease themselves. Protect them, grant them strength and sustain them in their call of duty. Help them to stay safe!

Almighty. We ask You to put a halt to the spread of the virus. May we be sensible during this difficult period & learn to be compassionate & empathize with everyone because it has become a global problem. May we use this time in isolation to reflect on our link with You. Aameen!

Every now and then your faith will be tested. Don’t expect everything to be smooth all the time. You will panic. You will be fearful. But at the end of the day, you must believe that you will make it. Why? Because the Almighty has promised He won’t test us beyond our capacity!

Life doesn’t look back. It just carries on, with or without you. Be prepared for whatever comes your way. When you least expect it, it will test you & challenge you. How you respond will set the tone for the rest of your life. Don’t take things for granted. Be on your guard.

Use your time alone in isolation to purify yourself and refine your faith. It’s a good time to clean up the heart from diseases that have bogged you down and prevented you from moving forward. Learn to appreciate one another so you can support one another in good & bad times.

We have no words to describe our gratitude to those on the frontline besides a prayer to the Almighty for all of you and your loved ones.

We’re living in testing times. Isn’t it amazing how man is always making plans for his life. Some of us have even made plans for the entire year! In one fell swoop, the Almighty has shown the world His Prowess. Plans have had to be changed, adjusted or even cancelled!

Keep calling out to the Almighty. Ask for forgiveness, for mercy not just for yourself but for family & loved ones. All such acts are forms of worship & they carry great reward. Isn’t that simply beautiful? Just for asking, you’re rewarded. Call on Him sincerely. He will respond!

Change can happen as quickly or as slowly as the person so chooses. A crisis like the #coronavirus outbreak can be a catalyst for change. It’s a good time to renew our connection and get closer to Almighty. If you’ve  neglected Him before, don’t fret. Get back on track now!

This is a time of test. From all angles. People are losing loved ones. Jobs. Financial security. The list goes on. Stay strong. Spiritually. Mentally. Emotionally. Don’t cave in. Difficult days are ahead. Draw closer to the Almighty. He’s the only One who can get us through this!

There are still people who aren’t taking this #coronavirus outbreak seriously. Remember, it’s not just about you. Spare a thought for family & loved ones, especially the elderly. You may be young & healthy but there are those whose immune system is compromised. Don’t be selfish!

Now is the time to get closer to the Almighty. Commit yourself to depend on Him and repent to Him. Speak to Him about your woes and fears and anxieties. He will shine a light in your darkness. Don’t worry. Don’t fret. He knows what’s going on. Stay connected to Him always!

Stop overthinking. The coronavirus is a test! This test will expose how true we are to our faith! Sadly, we’re failing. Look at the hoarding, the panic buying etc. We’re supposed to want for others what we want for ourselves. We're supposed to be drawing closer to the Almighty!

Now is the time to show you truly care about humanity. Remember, it’s not all about you. Be of help to the people you care about; family, friends, neighbours, the elderly, the aged, the homeless. The list is endless. Find it in your heart to give generously whatever you can!

Almighty. Forgive our sins & grant us ease in this time of distress & anxiety. We ask You to stop the spread of #coronavirus that’s taken the world by storm. Grant healing & comfort to those who’ve been infected. Give us a strong sense of social responsibility to do what’s right!

Whatever is happening around you should never make you lose your inner peace. Trust the Almighty & keep hope alive. No matter how chaotic the world has become, you must remain in a positive state of mind. Never despair because the Lord of the Worlds is in full control!

The isolation many have to undergo can only be a good thing. It’s an excellent way to protect our faith & to safeguard us during these confusing times. We always want more time for ourselves & family so use this period wisely. Mind your own business; keep out of harm’s way!

A #virus that is invisible to the naked eye is causing mayhem worldwide. Everyone is feeling a sense of unease. It’s not business as usual. We have to get used to a new norm for a while. Ask the Almighty for strength so that we can remain patient as we face the coming days!

If you’re on quarantine, resist the urge to waste time. If you’re glued to social media amidst this #corona #outbteak you need to put things in perspective. It’s NOT business as usual! There may be a global crisis but internally your link with the Almighty shouldn’t be in crisis!

As more countries go into #lockdown people are having to grapple with a host of emotions. The fear, the uncertainty, the loneliness , the helplessness. Don’t despair. #covid19 may be spreading like wildfire but the Almighty’s in total control! He knows what we’re going through!

Let’s face it. We fight battles daily. No one knows about them except the Almighty. Never forget that He is All-Knowing and He can help all. There is no pain or struggle that He is not aware of. He never ignores your pain. Remember, you’re not alone, even on your darkest days!

Protect your inner peace and all the emotions that go with it. It’s important for your overall well-being. Don’t get involved in other people’s drama, no matter how much they try and persuade you. Save your energy for the important things that the Almighty will send your way!

Social responsibility has become even more important in this #coronavirus outbreak. It’s  not all about you. Cultivate good habits not just for yourself but with others in mind. Take social distancing seriously. Be concerned about physical & health safety for yourself & others!

Don’t take the #coronavirus outbreak lightly. Preventing its spread is an obligation. Take all necessary steps & precaution towards this end. Remember, it’s now a #pandemic, global crisis. So we all have to play our part. Don’t harm others & don’t be a source of harm! Stay safe

Whatever is stressing you, learn to let it go. Remember you were never in control in the first place. Everything that happens is by the Almighty’s Will and Decree. So don’t burden yourself with such stresses. Seek relief from Him alone. He will make a way out for you eventually!

Your friends play an important role in your life. Be careful who you get close to because you start becoming like them. Your thoughts ideas and actions mimic your friends. It can be the most rewarding experience or the most difficult one. It’s your choice. Do it wisely!

There’s no need to panic about #coronavirus but there’s a need to be intelligent & take precautions. There’s so much information out there & it’s easy to get overwhelmed. Keep it simple. The basics hold true. Stay alert & vigilant. Look out for others. That’s the best way to be!

Let us change our thinking and go beyond merely treating others how we want to be treated. Think about others the way you’d want them to think of you. Feel for others the way you’d want them to feel about you. Speak to others the way you’d like them to speak to you! Try it today!

Everyone is going through a struggle. You have yours & I have mine. Don’t hurt others with your words. Speak kindly or remain silent. Be sensitive to people’s feelings especially during this difficult period where everyone is anxious & on edge. May the Almighty guide us always!

Don’t overthink. Don’t let little things bother you to such an extent that you find it hard to carry on in life. There’s a good reason why many people lose their composure when faced with small irritants. Identify yours and get hold of yourself before it spirals out of control!

There’s so much going on around us today that it’s easy to focus on frustration, fatigue and irritations! Don’t! Take it one step at a time because the Almighty is in full control. Do your best. Surrender to His Decree. You will have enough energy to get through your day.

Almighty. Help us to stay calm amidst the fear, noise and chaos  all around us. We’re feeling anxious and overwhelmed by the mounting worries of life. It feels like everything is spinning out of control. Grant us ease and the ability to refocus on what truly matters. Aameen!

Stop comparing yourself with others. Recognise and appreciate what the Almighty has blessed you with for your journey. You’re special and no one else is like you. He’s tailor made exactly what you need because He knows you better than you know yourself. Be grateful always!

Get rid of that pride in your heart. Picture yourself lying in your grave, would any of this matter? Let go of diseases of the heart, one by one. It takes a concerted effort. It won’t happen overnight. But if you’re serious, it can & will happen! Seek your strength from Him.

There’ll be times in our lives where the Almighty will allow us to go through things that we don't understand. We must trust that there is a purpose behind His plan. That’s faith. Always believe that He wants the best for us. He will work things out eventually! Without a doubt!

Don’t waste time. Don’t put off till tomorrow what you should be doing today. Life is short. Death awaits us. Do as many good deeds as possible before our time is up. Yesterday can never be tomorrow. Don’t listen to Satan. If he can’t make you sin, he will make you waste time!

Just because you haven’t got it all figured out, you’re NOT a failure. Learn to take things in your stride. Don’t get impatient when you see others achieving their goals. Your timing is your timing. Keep giving your best! The Almighty has it all worked out. Trust His Wisdom!

Who are among the strongest? Those who make time to help others, even when they’re struggling with their own issues. Life is about service to others. Each day, we’re preoccupied with ourselves & our selfish needs. Start reaching out to others & see how life is transformed!

The Almighty never told us that this life would be all sunshine and rainbows. We’re here to be tested. The world will bring you down to your knees often. It will keep you there if you allow it. Don’t! Get right up. Keep going the way He has prescribed for us. Remain steadfast!

The bottom line is you really can’t count on people to motivate & build you up in life. The truth is everyone is so caught up in  their own lives that they have little or no time for others. Learn to encourage yourself but remember not to leave the Almighty out of the equation!

You are what you feed your mind. Today we suffer from TMI! Too much information or information overload. Remember, your mental diet is just as important as your food intake. Thoughts are powerful food for your mind. What you believe, you become. So think positive thoughts!

The life lessons sent your way are never wasted. The Almighty doesn’t waste anything. He has a reason & purpose for everything that happens in your life. It is all  part of your journey. The challenges, setbacks, delays, roadblocks are all there for your own good! Trust Him!

The Almighty will pave the way for you to meet many people during your lifetime. Some will be past reflections of a repeated  cycle you’ve experience in your life. Others will steer you towards a new start. That’s why it’s important to attract the right people into your life!

Be aware of how you speak to people. You may come across as trying to one up the other person in many ways with a more powerful story than theirs. Pay attention to such things. It shows you care about what they’re saying; that you’re not just trying to push your own agenda!

Almighty. We pray for everyone across the globe, for safety as well as comfort amidst uncertainty and crisis. We ask for Your guidance and direction. We are completely reliant on You, especially during these challenging times. May we never take good health for granted. Aameen!

Don’t sit around & wait for things to happen. Get up & do! Work on something that will help you move forward in life; that will make you a better person, more caring, more compassionate, more selfless & more importantly leaving a mark of goodness and kindness wherever you go!

When something bad happens, you either bear patience or panic. By enduring & bearing patience, you earn a great reward & accept the will & decree of the Almighty. But if you react with anger & worry, you’re forgetting who is in complete control of every aspect of your existence!

Satan will cause you grief & stress. When you keep having negative thoughts of pain & sorrow, he will worsen your condition. So get a perspective on life. Remember, this world is a mix of ease & hardship, joy & sorrow, hope & pain. Do your best to adopt a positive mindest!

We need to stop complaining about what goes on in our lives. Every storm was designed to make us stronger, because all things that come from the Almighty always work together for our good.There are others who are struggling way more than we could ever imagine. Pray for them!

Don’t get arrogant and think that you did it all on your own. Nothing can be achieved without the Almighty’s Will. Remember, it’s not your talent but His Mercy. It’s not your hard work but His Blessing. It’s not your knowledge but His Wisdom. So be humble and thank Him profusely!

Why is it so hard to rejoice when the Almighty blesses others? Many of us will think, why didn’t He bless me like that? Stop! When we’re not happy for those who have been blessed, it shows a lack of griatitufe for all that He has done for us. Learn to be gracious and generous!

We are all on separate journeys but heading towards the same  destination! We just need to stay in our own lanes. Trust in yourself, trust that you are doing the best you can, no matter what life throws at you. Always believe that the Almighty wants the best for you! Keep going!

When you’ve done something wrong... Don’t try to shift the blame. Don’t run from your mistakes. Don’t try to pass the burden of your mistakes. Don’t make a mistake worse by not owning it, by trying to sweep it under the carpet or pass it onto someone else’s shoulders!

Don’t allow anything to break you. Things can test you as they often do. But no matter how hard you fall, get back up & start over. That’s the mark of an achiever. Giving up is not an option. No amount of pressure can stop the energy within. You’re resilient. You’re worth it!

When everything seems to grind to a halt and you start thinking that you’re a loser, think again.  Is there any limit to the Almighty’s Prowess? He’s the Lord of the Worlds. Did He not bring you this far? Do you think He will abandon you now? Trust Him, nothing is impossible!

Do you get anxious often? Wondering what’s to come, worrying about the future. Sometimes you feel at peace, the next moment you’re panicking, having palpitations. You need to start focusing on the Almighty, trusting His plans for you. You need to know that He has your back!

You’ll never be short of critics. It’s made even more challenging in our digital world because most of them are anonymous. Learn to take criticisms in your stride. You don’t have to respond to everyone. Sort the constructive from the destructive. Never compromise your self-worth!

When the Almighty closes your door, none can open it besides Him. And when he opens your door, none can close it besides Him. His timing is always perfect. Don't underestimate His Power, Wisdom & Mercy. Turn to Him at all times. Good & bad. Trust Him for He knows best!

Keep praying for patience & contentment. We live in such a materialistic world that it can be hard to resist what we see around us. Don’t be tempted to have the latest in everything; fashion, electronic gadgets & smart devices, cars etc. Spend that money on a good cause instead!

It’s easy to post a comment on social media without giving it much thought. It only takes a few seconds. Just like texting. It’s easy to make a sarcastic remark or make fun of someone with your words. Words can reduce a person’s self-esteem in an instant! Watch your words!

Bend but don’t break. You might think it’s easy to say but so hard to do. The bending part of life is what redefines human capacity. You’re more resilient than you think you are. Remember, the Almighty will not burden us with that which we have no ability to bear!

Social media fatigue is real. It affects people in more ways than you can imagine. Is your smartphone the first thing you look for when you wake? Are you spending time on too many social media sites engaging your followers and interacting with them on everything under the sun?

Almighty. Many of us need healing from past hurts & events that have left us totally broken. Replace our pain, weakness & sorrow with comfort.  We know You can heal us in a heartbeat. Grant ease to our hearts so we can be strong again. Heal our soul & make us whole once more!

Spend some time each day reflecting on what you’re putting into your book of deeds. We have a merciful Lord where our bad deeds can still be erased after we’ve committed them. All it needs is sincere repentance. Don’t delay. Don’t despair. Make it a book you’ll be proud of!

In this age where people are conditioned to look ‘perfect’, have the courage to be yourself. Be you, be real and not fake things about yourself just to fit into society’s image. Be authentic, be sincere and the Almighty will open doors for you which you never imagined before.

The Almighty knows our struggles. He has seen the tears and heard our prayers. The best we can hope for is to believe that relief is near. Very near. He has promised us. Remember, whatever suffering & sorrows we have now, will be forgotten once we lay our eyes on Paradise!

It can be easy to get caught up in the affairs of the world and forget to stop and show our  appreciation for what we have in this life. The Almighty is the most generous & yet we tend to take things for granted. Remember, a life well lived is one of gratitude and thankfulness!

We all have problems. But when you overthink your situation, it becomes unhealthy. Make an effort to not dwell on past events. Repeating in your mind negative experiences, asking “why me?” could end up with greater suffering. Focus on the positives to offset your worries!

The more confident you are, the quieter you become. Confidence whispers, insecurity roars. Confident people are not attention seekers. Their mere presence is loud enough for the world to see. Contrarily, the insecure ones are the loudest, drawing most attention to themselves.

Don't speak negatively about your spouse to others; including friends & family! By doing so you’re destroying the life within your relationship. You’re inviting Satan to dwell on the negatives. Even if your spouse has done wrong, speak to him/her privately, not to a third party!

People are so caught up with trends these days. Let’s be trendsetters of a different kind. Don’t judge, be understanding instead. Don’t shame & expose. Choose compassion & empathy. Don’t hurt, be kind and helpful always. Make a conscious effort to do things differently!

Social media envy is real. It’s fuelled by the fact that people share only their finest moments as if the whole aim of their social media presence is to inspire envy. It’s dangerous. Let’s try and keep it real. Don’t be shallow and materialistic. Get busy with real life instead!

No matter how harsh life gets, you remember the beautiful things the Almighty has promised you. That’s true patience. You keep enduring no matter how terrible you feel inside because you know it won’t last. You never inflict pain on others or let it affect how you treat them.

Respect other people’s time.  Your time, your needs, your demands are just as valuable as theirs. Exercise discretion on deadlines & requests. It doesn’t take much to train yourself to be respectful of other people’s time, after all, wouldn’t you want them to do the same for you?

Don’t ask the Almighty for something and then complain about what follows. If you want to achieve your goals, you have to go through setbacks, failure, diversions; but these don’t last. Nothing does actually. So don’t make permanent decisions based on temporary situations!

Do you want inner peace & serenity? Focus on the Almighty. Make Him a part of your life. Daily. Not just when calamity strikes. Nothing else will give you that much eluded feeling which many are searching for in everything worldly. You’ll achieve a sense of peace like no other!

Everyday, make a concerted effort to replace negative thoughts from your mind with positive ones. May the overthinking & pessimism exit your mind. May clarity replace confusion. May peace and serenity reign in your heart. Do this diligently and you’ll be ready for more blessings!

When you’re doing well, expect negative criticisms. Use that as a signal to recommit to your work; refocus on the road ahead. Some people are determined to take things personally & tear down the work of others. Your life’s too short to worry about pleasing those difficult people!

The world doesn’t need to know everything. If you want to give, give. If you want to help, help. There’s no need to make a song & dance about it. The amazing is often found in the anonymous. It’s often the ones working tirelessly in the background who are the most selfless!

How you deal with things says a lot about you. Being calm when there’s chaos doesn’t happen overnight. It comes when you have full trust in the Almighty. Instead of overthinking and overreacting, you just hand over everything to Him after you’ve given your best shot at things.

Almighty. When things don’t work out the way we want or expect, help us to be contented. May we embrace whatever happens in good spirit. Let us focus on having a positive mindset because You are All-Knowing. You’re the most powerful and You’re in control of our destiny. Aameen!

In this stressful life of ours, we tend to take people for granted. Don’t! No matter how nice people are, remember everyone has their limits. Don’t cross that limit.  Don’t make unrealistic demands on others because one day, they  will snap! Don’t forget we are human after all!

When you’ve wronged someone, don’t try to turn the tables & make yourself the wronged party. You may think you’re getting away with it but the Almighty knows the whole story. In fact, you should be afraid because when it all comes back to you, the truth will out. He knows best!

When we face the storms of life, do we bear beautiful patience, anchor our roots deeper or do we waver and get knocked down? That’s why it’s important to keep drawing closer to the Almighty in good times so when bad times come, He will see us through!

Don’t be a control freak. Don’t micromanage. Embrace uncertainty because that’s part of life. Plan meticulously by all means but trying to be in control every step of the way is unhealthy. The Almighty is the best planner. He will steer things in the right direction for you!

We’re all imperfect, serving a perfect Creator who’s most Merciful. He doesn’t expect perfection from us. All He wants is for us to try & do our best. Are we giving our best? He knows what’s in the hearts & He knows us better than we know ourselves. So let’s get our act together!

Being kind costs nothing. Kind acts and kind words will go a long way to put someone back on their feet. They have the power to give strength, motivate, boost self-esteem and increase confidence. What’s holding you back? Remember, in a world where you can be anything, be kind!

Are you on the verge of giving up? Don’t! Stay patient for a while longer. The Almighty wants you to know that the battle is not over. Remember, it’s darkest before dawn. He works miracles. Trust Him because He has not stopped working in your favour.

People can’t stand it when someone else is doing well. They'll try to plant seeds of doubt & negativity. They may even spread falsehoods just to hijack your success story. Don’t worry about their plans. The Almighty is fully aware & All-Knowing. Trust Him to pave your journey!

What will you be known for when you leave this earth? Have you given it a thought? Start by being kind; spread goodness wherever you go. One of the best ways to be remembered is to touch people’s hearts with acts of kindness.Your legacy is the story there’ll share about you!

There are many out there who need direction. They’re lost or simply in a state of limbo waiting for something to happen. As much as you can do your part, remember that guidance comes from the Almighty. Commit yourself totally to Him and trust Him to unfold a good plan for you!

Let’s be honest. We all worry. We do it daily. But let us not stress ourselves by worrying about things which are beyond our control. The Almighty knows every single aspect of our lives. He has equipped us well to face life challenges. Patience, gratitude & trust. Embrace them!

You may not be in a place where you’d like to be right now but know that this is part of your life journey. You have to overcome this before moving to the next level. It’s part of the Almighty’s Plan. So embrace the journey knowing that nothing lasts. Bear patience! Trust Him!

Don’t worry about people having ill intent towards you. Protect yourself the best way you can but remember there’s no might greater than the Almighty. When He protects you, no one can touch you. Never lose that link with Him. Always seek protection from Him and Him Alone.

Don’t complicate life. What you give, you get. Even when your actions are not reciprocated, keep doing good. Why? Because the Almighty loves those who do good. Life’s too short to be doing otherwise. You’ll fail, you’ll feel lost but if you keep Him in focus, you’ll be fine!

It’s a misconception to think that you need to turn your life around before you can start praying & getting close to the Almighty. No! Start worshipping Him amid the mess & chaos around you. Don’t let Satan tell you otherwise. No matter what’s going on in your life, pray!

Understand the plan of the Almighty. He’s going to test your character. Are you paying lip service to your faith? He will send challenges in many forms. Your wealth, your children, people you mix around with etc. He will look at your heart. If you’re sincere, you’ll succeed!

You’ll encounter difficult people in life. It’s always about them. They’ll drain your energy rather than uplift you. They make it their job to see what’s wrong rather than what’s right. Be kind. Give them a listening ear. Try & be reasonable. If it doesn’t work, don’t feel bad!

Almighty. Grant us comfort amid the hardships we’re facing. Give us the strength & resilience to weather the storms passing by. We know You’re with us and though we are overwhelmed at times, we are not in despair. Make us content and humble as we lay our full trust in You!

You worked hard but didn’t get promoted. You love her but she married someone else. You think life’s unfair! No. It’s wishful thinking. The reality is that the Almighty is protecting you from things that will happen in future which you can’t foresee! Learn to accept His Decree!

Live life one day at a time. Focus on making it the best day. There’s so much uncertainty & chaos around us; it’s easy to get sucked into the fray. Don’t. Maintain your peace. Take it in your stride. Trust the Almighty. It makes no sense to worry because worry changes nothing.

Do you sometimes feel like you take two steps forward but fall back by one step? This happens to the best of us. Success is not a linear progression. Many things can hold you back. The point is to not let setbacks deter you from achieving your goal. Keep going. You’ll get there!

Man is often ungrateful; always focusing on what’s not going right. Why? There are so many things we need to thank the Almighty for & yet we get stuck in this “what’s lacking in my life mode!” Change the mindset. Don’t miss out on His abundant blessings! Gratitude is key!

Stop complaining & start living. Whenever you’re tempted to complain, look at the suffering around you. It’s a wake up call to be grateful for all that the Almighty has blessed you with. To complain when we have so much going for us is a downright insult to the real sufferers!

Many of us are hesitant to do kind acts because we’re always waiting for that perfect moment. There’s no such thing. Anytime is perfect for you to do good & spread kindness. The Almighty’s not looking for perfection. He’s interested in your heart & intent. That’s the reward!

Fame is a double-edged sword. Not many can handle it. Tamper it with reality, you should be fine. Let it get to your head, it could spell trouble! Arrogance & ego come into play. You may end up a different person! It’s a test from the Almighty. He’s watching your moves!

One of the best ways to get through life is to change the way we respond to things. It’s all about perspective and our attitude towards things. While we do not have control over everything that happens in our lives, we do have control over how we allow things to affect us!

Remember that you do not make yourself look better by making someone else look worse. You do not appear more pious by implying that others are less pious. Don’t ever go that route. Just focus on yourself and let people do what they have to do. The Almighty is the Best Judge!

Negativity gets you nowhere. If you’re holding on to negative thoughts, you’ll always be struggling and feeling low. Delete those negative thoughts and choose a positive mindset. No one determines your destiny but the Almighty. Don’t let anyone plant any such thoughts in you!

When things aren’t going well, it’s easy to sink into depths of despair & allow Satan to cloud your mind. Resist it! Rise above it, shake yourself free; dry your tears. Refocus your energy & reclaim your faith. The Almighty’s waiting for you. You’ll succeed in spite of it all!

When you fail at something, it’s a test from the Almighty. It shouldn’t stop you. If you don’t succeed, try again. The biggest mistake is to give up. He’s watching to see how hard you’re trying, how badly you really want it. For every obstacle, there’s a solution! Keep at it!

Beat that move! 😊😊

Preparing for the Light Upon Light Vacation in Antalya Turkey from 5 to 9 April to 2020. Open to all from around the world. To join us check out https://t.co/tLWo4Qv3Mf to book. https://t.co/pEqA3YC45e

When you’re unsure, unsettled and confused over a situation, turn to the Almighty for ease. Trust Him for a way out; in fact the best solution from the best of planners. He will direct your steps; be your compass and guide you through it. Peace will reign again  in your heart!

Faith over fear. That’s what we need in this confusing time. We hear so much & often suffer from information overload. What fraction of it is real? Be discerning & informed. Don’t just believe everything you hear. Challenges & uncertainties will come. Trust the Almighty always!

Don’t take life for granted. Here today, gone tomorrow is indeed real! Many of us have seen it happen to our loved ones and close friends. We never know when our time will be up. So forgive, spread goodness and pray that the Almighty takes us when He is most pleased with us!

Don’t apologize for taking time out for yourself. You’re human! Self-care should not be neglected. How can you continue to give and do your best if you’re in a bad state. Learn to say no when you have to without explaining yourself. Those who appreciate you will understand!

Almighty. Grant us comfort and strength during these times of crisis and chaos the world over. Surround us with clarity and light amid the upheaval. We know You are with us and would never forsake us. Help us to keep the peace in our hearts which can only come from You! Aameen.

Don’t fret if your efforts don’t receive much or any recognition or publicity. Know that the Almighty’s protecting your sincerity & work from corruption. Most importantly, remember, He loves those deeds that are small & consistent. They are the most beneficial in the long run.

Always pray for a good ending. 
Oftentimes we are obsessed with the goings-on around us that we forget what our purpose is! Where are we headed? The journey is important. But ultimately what happens in the end is what matters most. Many start well but few will finish strong!

Wake each morning thanking the Almighty because no one knows what each day may bring. No matter what’s going on in our lives, show utmost gratitude. A new day is a gift, a blessing from Him. Not everyone gets it. Some had huge plans for today but didn’t wake up! So thank Him!

Have you been waiting for a while? Waiting for your test to be over; for the Almighty to grant ease; for the bad moments to fade. Waiting is about patience. Patience leads to success. It’s not easy; not for the faint hearted. It’s based on sincerity & prayer, wisdom & hope!

What we see as mistakes can actually be a turning point. The Almighty can turn the mistake into a huge blessing. It’s up to you to see it or are you too busy wallowing in self-pity?  Don’t beat yourself up for the mistakes you've made. Use them to propel you to the next level!

What people think of you doesn’t matter. In this social media age we’re fixated on perception; it’s all about what people think of us, how they view us, their approval etc. Take a step back. It’s the Almighty’s approval we need. If He’s pleased with us, nothing else matters!

Never give up when the going gets tough. Never quit at the first sign of difficulty. Life was never meant to be easy; it’s a constant struggle with lows and highs. The times when it’s most important to persevere are the times that you will be most tested. Keep going. Trust Him!

Remember that life is not a sprint but a marathon. The race is not for the fastest nor the strongest who can flex his muscles but for those who will run at a steady pace till the end. With utmost endurance and patience. The ultimate test of your faith. Do you have what it takes?

When you ask the Almighty for something, ask with confidence. Ask with positivity. He always hears and knows what is best for you. If what He gave you seemed like a NO to your request, understand that He has something much better in store. Embrace what you have and look ahead!

When someone is hurtful or racist towards you, don’t reciprocate. It doesn’t give you the green light to behave the same towards them.  Don’t let the ugliness of someone else’s character change who you are.  Remember that ugliness is a reflection of their character. Not yours!

Life isn't about who you once were. It's about who you are & have the potential to be! Everyone has a past. So don’t worry about those who keep bringing up your past. Don't let such talk deter you from looking ahead with positivity. Seek your strength from the Almighty!

Remember that words like impossible, unheard of, unthinkable, unknown, unseen, and unexpected don’t mean anything to the Almighty. He can make everything happen at the drop of a hat. Your task is to do your best and trust Him completely with your life. You will be unstoppable!

So the Almighty doesn’t give you what you’ve been asking for and you think He doesn’t love you. Never think that way of Him because He knows what you don’t! He could be saving you from a calamity. Unanswered prayers can be your greatest blessings. Have faith, trust Him always!

Let’s face it. You are not going to wake up every morning feeling like you can conquer the world. That’s ok. But don’t quit. Those “low” days are crucial in your development. The Almighty will see you through. Place your firm belief and trust in Him. Your load  will lighten.
#BuildingBridges #SierraLeone @ZainBhikha https://t.co/LEs4MaR973

The Almighty puts different people in our lives for different reasons. No one is there by accident. Learn to identify the people He has placed in your life and be sensitive to the purpose they serve. Some won’t be there forever. There is a time, place and purpose for everything.

Almighty. Protect us from being leaking buckets; those who engage in bad deeds just after doing good acts of worship. May we not be among those who pray, fast and give charity but curse, swear, gossip and backbite without batting an eyelid. Help us stay away from  such behaviour.

This is life. People will cause you pain, hurt you, put you down, make you feel bad about yourself, as if you’re the bad one! It’s how you react that will determine the outcome. They are powerless until you choose to empower them. Don’t give them that privilege.

Don’t behave as you please in front of your children. Words that come out of your mouth should never be swear words. They’ll pick it up in a heartbeat. Control the tongue & your manners too. They’re more likely to follow your example than your advice. Show them the best way!

When your heart is broken, you think you’ve reached the end of the road and you feel empty; be careful what you fill it with! Satan is an opportunist. He will cause doubt & unleash evil thoughts; strive to block him out. Turn to the Almighty. Seek His help. Only He can heal you!
#SierraLeone #BuildingBridges @ZainBhikha https://t.co/d40Lk28ofr

Be mindful of your reaction to those who’ve wronged you. Two wrongs do not make a right. You can’t be mean, angry or bitter & expect goodness in return. Don’t become obsessed with revenge. Let the Almighty handle it. Be the better, kinder person always. Rise above it all.

Don’t complicate your life. If you want something done, do it yourself if you can. If you want to change a bad habit, go for it. Don’t just talk about it. If something distresses you, get to the bottom of it. Above all, always keep the Almighty on your radar. You’ll get there!

We’re becoming more  preoccupied with the worldly stuff that we forget death is inevitable. It can come anytime; yet we always think we have time on our side. Don’t be foolish. May we realize this sooner rather than later and not be among those filled with regret in our graves!

Do you go through life thinking you have so many problems to solve? Every little thing is an issue? You’re always complaining. You get irritated easily. Focusing on what isn’t going right is a sure way to attract more negativity. Count your blessings! Think positive thoughts!

Sometimes the Almighty closes doors because it’s time to move on. The trouble is we may not see this. We keep knocking but nothing happens. He knows what He’s doing. He also knows that we won’t move unlesss He creates some discomfort for us! Change is not easy! Trust Him.

In real life, no one has it all together. Don’t believe anyone who says he does. Sometimes life gets overwhelming but our faith carries us through. Giving up is not an option. Every single one of us is fighting an unseen battle, often hidden by a brave exterior. Be empathetic!

Don’t live life thinking about the past. Learn from your mistakes and live to realise the full potential that the Almighty has blessed you with. The journey is important but the end is even more crucial. Pray for guidance and strength always. May He grant us the best outcome!

Don’t compare your marriage to what you see online. There will always be people who post pictures making it look like they’re having a better time than you and your spouse! Avoid the temptation to make a comparison. Envy is dangerous. Disastrous even; so stay offline if you must!

We may get too dependent on people in our lives till we forget that the Almighty’s the only One in complete control of our existence. So He removes people from our lives for our own protection. Not everyone will like you. Not everyone wants good for you! Depend on Him alone!

It’s sad how some people are so jealous & intimidated by you that they only have negative things to say when they know absolutely nothing about you. It’s common practice today; in fact it’s the norm. May the Almighty protect our tongues from saying things which harm others!

Don’t let worry control you. That’s what Satan wants. He wants you to worry and live in doubt. Don’t let stress consume you too. Take things in your  stride. Think positive. Always look for solutions. Take a deep breath and know that the Almighty has it all worked out for you.

People love labels. They’ll use it loosely and indiscriminately on anyone and everyone. Don’t pay heed to any of that. How you think & feel about yourself is determined by you. Don’t listen to the noise around you. Cut it out. Focus on your tasks ahead. A lot needs to be done.

Almighty. Give us the strength & courage to stay firm & hold on to our faith & belief. Don’t make us among those who are people pleasers, losing ourselves in a crowd just because we want to fit in. Help us to worry less about what others think of us. Only You matter in the end!

Life’s a journey; from the Almighty & back to Him eventually. As a traveler you must chart your course based on what He has prescribed for you. You will fail, you will fall & you’ll get up again. Don’t be afraid to make U-turns. Seek His help often. He is the best GPS you have!

Whatever you give attention to grows in importance. Don’t dwell on critics and haters. Focus on your Creator and His plans for you & your life. Don’t worry about those trying to put you down. Your job is to respect others and not to hurt anyone. Do your best. He’ll do the rest!

Don’t brag about your achievements. Don’t make a song and dance about it. Whatever the Almighty has bestowed on you, protect it. Guard your blessings because people tend to ruin it. Yes, even the best of friends and the ones with pure hearts can ruin whatever you have.

Tired & weary as you are in your journey, you’re not alone. Your heart feels so much pain. You’re not alone. You need to be patient with what the Almighty has planned for you. For how long ? All your sacrifices will be worth it. The more patient you are, the greater your reward!

It’s inevitable to look at others & yearn for their lifestyle on social media. Next time you find yourself doing that, stop & think if it’s fair to compare your life with theirs when you’re only seeing a portion of their life they want you to see. You don’t have the full story!

Stay positive. It’s the catalyst for survival in life. Your ability to be able to see the glass half full rather than half empty is the key to being happy and appreciating where you are in life. Gratitude is key. The Almighty will bestow you with more when you’re grateful!

Losing someone you love is a huge test of faith. That’s the reality of this life. How you pick yourself up and carry on shows how much you understand the Almighty’s plan. May He help us cope with our loss and reunite us with our loved ones in Paradise.

Choose what you want in life. Happiness or sadness. It seems quite obvious but many don’t follow it up with action. If you want to be happy, work for it. Be proactive. Get the Almighty’s help not just for worldly things. Bit by bit your life will change. You’ll be content!

Just because you’ve been having one disappointment after another, doesn’t mean things won’t get better. Trust the Almighty. The beauty of letting Him take over is that He knows us better than we know ourselves. Believe that whatever it is will arrive in His perfect timing!

You may think that everything is going wrong. The truth is something is still going right. You lose one thing, you gain another! When you can’t think of anything you’ve gained, there are still countless blessings to be thankful for. So when broken hearted, draw closer to Him!

It takes a huge amount of courage & strength to forget about what you’re going through, the troubles in life & put on a smile for the world to see. Appreciate how strong such people are for being able to stay positive in spite of everything! So always be kind to those you meet!

Cherish the scars you get in life. They serve as a constant reminder that you struggled & strove to be who you are today. Not everyone can handle life crisis. Among the most beautiful people are those who've known defeat, suffering, struggle, loss & they emerged winners!

How you feel about yourself should not be dictated by someone else’s opinion, points of view, words or thoughts. People will say what they want and they’ll judge. That’s human nature. Let it be. Don’t give them so much power over you. Stand your ground and just be yourself!

When you think your life’s falling apart; you’re going through a divorce, just lost your job, financial difficulties abound, your health’s suffering. It’s times like these where you need to draw even closer to the Almighty. Trust Him amid the pain. He will shine His light on you!

People & circumstances around you may try to push you down. But don’t worry; the Almighty is All-Knowing. He knows what to do. He knows who has evil intent; who’s trying to help you up & will give you a hand! He puts people in your life for different purposes. Trust Him!

Doubt and disbelief - Satan’s handiwork! Don’t fall prey to any of that. Keep a lid on his whispering that will always come back to you. That is his forte. He will never give up. That’s why you need to bolt the door and focus on your journey ahead. Don’t let him trick you.

Almighty. Grant us peace of mind to ease our troubled hearts. The soul feels like a turbulent sea. It’s hard to navigate the troubled waters; we often stumble and worry constantly. Give us the strength and courage to steady ourselves and to stay afloat on the straight path.

You want to change things? Shift your mindset. Most things will never change until your mind does! Embrace positivity. Don’t let Satan or anyone mess with your mind. Keep your focus on your goal & work at it. The Almighty never said it’d be easy but He promised it’d be worth it!

Don’t always blame  circumstances for where you are in life. The Almighty has blessed everyone of us with so much, it’s up to us to use those blessings in the best way. People who make it in life are those who take charge & create circumstances instead of wandering aimlessly.

Stop making negative comments & spreading rumours about others. Not only are you ruining people’s reputation, you’re also giving yourself a bad name. Engage in positive activities and steer your mind towards all things good. You’ll end up attracting like-minded people! Try it!

Many people worry about not having figured out their lives. What does that really mean? As long as you’re on the path prescribed  by the Almighty and doing your best, trust Him to work it all out for you. You don’t have to figure everything out on your own. We have a loving Lord!

Some are so obsessed over winning an argument that they will do what it takes to get the upper hand. Don’t! Instead, take a step back and understand that no one ever wins in an argument. You often end up with a lot of bad feelings. Do your best to stay away from such situations!

Take ownership of your life. Don’t expect people to fix things for you when they go wrong as they often will. It’s not someone's responsibility to fill in the missing pieces of our lives. Learn to be self-sufficient.  Resolve your issues soonest possible. Don’t let them fester!

Make a concerted effort to remove guilt, anger, blame, resentment, regret, worry, envy and hate from your heart. Your life and health will improve dramatically once you eliminate these diseases. Peace and contentment will reign in your new mindset. Do it today!

In times of hardship, pain and loss who do you turn to first? Make sure you seek solutions and a way out from the Almighty instead of others. Let us not search for temporary comforts in people and worldly things. May we be among those who seek help through patience and prayer!

The Almighty is watching to see what you do with the wealth He has blessed you with. There are those who try to impress others with the money they have. They’re quick to spend money when it helps them look good, but don’t do anything to help people who desperately need it!

Don’t be an arrogant sinner. Quickly acknowledge your sin, repent and get back on track. The Almighty, with His limitless Mercy will forgive you. Remember, Paradise and Hellfire exist for sinners. The former for the repentant ones & the latter for those who are arrogant.

So your life’s a mess & you can’t find a way out. You’ve never felt so alone. Remember, in the blink of an eye, the Almighty can show you a way out. You only have to turn to Him. Ask Him. He’s capable of giving you what you want and more. He will heal you. He will protect you.
